result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Too pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Graduate from high school or obtain GED/HSED.
Defendant can apply to the court in writing for Youthful Expungment upon successful completion of probation and all conditions.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: To complete 50 hrs of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of a Controlled Substance, PTAC. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 as charged. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/11/14 by Officer Bilodeau. (fingerprint card destroyed 10/01/14)

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

ADDRESS INFO for Tiger A.F. Glynn
Current: E5358 7th Road, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2014)
Prior: 4247 Honeysuckle Ct Apt F101, Sheboygan, WI 53081

Defendant Tiger A.F. Glynn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
